text: Sorry to hear this. Any chance you can be a bit more specific?

<@U2H3TT8F2> Is this always reproducible or is it just this one module?

Can you send me a link to the module for both the source and destination portal?
I'll test today if it happens when moving to other portals. And DM you portal IDs and module name.

<@U2H3TT8F2> 
hey AJ, you can DM me too
:awthanks:

Hi community, maybe someone has found out a solution for this. In HubSpot when you insert a form field in a landing page the form module gives you three options: 1-The chance to choose one or several mails to send the converted form 2- The chance to include it in a workflow 3- The chance to choose a follow up email.
The issue begins when you use a form field within a Custome Module
then the form options disapear
we have managed to figure out how to get them back by adding Hubl code into the CM 
We have found out the hubl code for adding the option for follow up email and workflow but we don't get to the code needed for getting notification email option.                                              This is the code working for follow up option
simple_email_for_live_id="{{ module.followupemail_field }}"
 form_follow_ups_follow_up_type="simple"
This one for workflows options
form_follow_ups_workflow_id = {{ module.workflow_field }}
and this is what we have tried for emailnotifications but in this case is not working
notifications_are_overridden=True
          notifications_override_email_addresses =[{{ module.email_field }} (edited)
                                                              We have managed to include emails for notification with
notifications_are_overridden=True
         notifications_override_email_addresses =["<mailto:jedwar@inboundemotion.com|jedwar@inboundemotion.com>", "<mailto:jnavarrete@inboundemotion.com|jnavarrete@inboundemotion.com>"]

but this means you have to code in the module every mail you want to send notification, the option does not appear in the settings for the user to easyly add emails.

anyone has find themselves in the same issue? Any ideas from HubSpotters?

Sure thing! 

Speed-wise: it is always slow to work in the v2 but yesterday it was taking us 3x as long as usual to make changes or change from one template to another...sometimes it would completely freeze

Iframe-wise: the iframes seemed to be gone, so the sidebar would disappear as you scrolled down the template to find a module and then you would have to select that module and then scroll all the way back up to make any edits to it
<!here> We are hearing reports of performance issue with the new Design Manager. If you are experiencing performance issues can you report those to this thread?
Everything's been running pretty slow for me today.  Changes have been taking a long time to publish and then even longer to actually show up on the pages/modules I'm trying to edit

I’ll echo what I said in another channel 
>does editing a module v2 get super laggy for anyone else? I’m using Chrome 67.0.3396.87 (Official Build)

The new version of design manager is making my CPU to run almost at 100% and my PC is getting very slow. From what I noticed, the tabs with the design manager consumes a lot of resources.  But that is happening only today, yesterday was alright...
*fingers crossed I don’t run into this*
editing isn’t very laggy for me but it’s taking ~15-20 seconds to publish any changes

also getting very weird behavior in the file path system to the left. Opened the folder that shows with the default Search modules and it disappeared entirely, though the modules still show in the search on the right. now closing the Global Content folder hides my root and template folders, which are siblings of it. Also noticed that after migrating a portal to DM2 yesterday, all my files moved from custom->page to custom->system->page and custom->page is gone entirely in the DM view, but shows as an empty directory in FTP
and now getting massive lag whenever I leave the page and come back to it - clicking back into the editor takes about 10 seconds
Also having some lag in the DMv2 when editing templates or custom modules. Even when the DM is the only tab I current have open. Chrome 67.0.3396.87 (Official Build) (64-bit)
lol, sounds like the new IDE is mining cryptos :smile:

Try removing your local storage, in chrome:
Application -> clear storage
*note: this will remove all unpublished changes you have done*
small issue: preview without display options doesn’t remove the top bar
<@UAY2E7JSU> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/UAY2E7JSU/FB6CPHY2D/2018-06-8f4wa.png|2018-06-8f4wa.png>
Noticed that same thing about preview yesterday and forgot to mention it here!

I think I found out kinda what is causing the design manager to be slow for everyone by accident - it appears to be the implementation of codemirror

There are a ton of constant DOM manipulations happening in the code mirror html, <https://spin.d.pr/Gb5C9g+>

(second part of the recording is codepen’s html - which is also using codemirror)
sorry ahead of time for linking to a gigantic gif
:thinking_face:
Another thing, this has been consistently happening to me for a few days now
Anyone seen this happen before? If you click “allow your team” it goes nowhere. Could be a marketplace issue but wanted to make sure it wasn’t something els
O_O what is that!? in b4 Shawn Bristow rocks our world with an announcement
Hey folks, we made a couple performance improvements where you should now see your CPU back in this solar system and not pinned at 100%. Let me know if your getting a lift from the upgrades… Thanks!
Wooooo!
<@U25C65C3S> Is that a yes, things are better, or just a woohoo, I’m gonna go and see if he is a liar? :wink:
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
my guess is a little from column a and a little from column b ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Was the "Preview without display options" button fixed?
Im trying to help people in the forums and they can't generate a link to the template for me to look at and I can't either for showing stuff to clients
I mean i can manually build the links for now, but its frustrating

like so in case anyone is wondering: 
```
<https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=[PORTALID]&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=[TEMPLATEIDNUMBER]>
```
Note: for blogs it shows only the detail page, need to add `blog_listing=true` to the parameters
You can also just get that link by using dev tools and inspecting the iframe
yup
We are working on a fix for the above Preview issue
For the record, I think you fixed the “display issues bug” with the performance tweaks … thanks <@U22PNRAJD>!
:thumbsup:
